cyber_attacks.name: Phishing Attack
cyber_attacks.description: A fraudulent attempt to obtain sensitive information by disguising as a trustworthy entity.
mitigation_techniques: Verify the sender's email address and URLs before clicking on any links.
Enable email filtering to identify and block suspicious emails.
Conduct regular employee training on identifying phishing attempts.

cyber_attacks.name: Ransomware
cyber_attacks.description: Malware that encrypts a victim's data and demands payment for the decryption key.
mitigation_techniques: Regularly back up important data to offline or cloud storage.
Keep all software, including antivirus, updated to the latest versions.
Implement strict access controls and endpoint protection.

cyber_attacks.name: SQL Injection
cyber_attacks.description: An attack that involves injecting malicious SQL code to manipulate a database.
mitigation_techniques: Use parameterized queries and prepared statements for database queries.
Sanitize and validate all user inputs before processing.
Implement robust error handling to avoid revealing database details.

cyber_attacks.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
cyber_attacks.description: A vulnerability that allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into webpages viewed by other users.
mitigation_techniques: Sanitize and encode user inputs to prevent script injection.
Implement Content Security Policy (CSP) to restrict the execution of untrusted scripts.
Regularly test and patch web applications for XSS vulnerabilities.

cyber_attacks.name: Denial-of-Service (DoS) Attack
cyber_attacks.description: An attack that overwhelms a network or service with excessive traffic to disrupt its functionality.
mitigation_techniques: Use firewalls and intrusion detection systems to identify and block malicious traffic.
Deploy load balancers to distribute traffic and prevent overloading.
Establish a response plan with your hosting provider for handling such attacks.

cyber_attacks.name: Man-in-the-Middle (MITM) Attack
cyber_attacks.description: An attack where a third party intercepts and manipulates communication between two parties.
mitigation_techniques: Use end-to-end encryption protocols like HTTPS and VPNs.
Avoid using public Wi-Fi for sensitive transactions.
Implement two-factor authentication for additional security.

cyber_attacks.name: Zero-Day Exploit
cyber_attacks.description: An attack that targets a software vulnerability unknown to the vendor or public.
mitigation_techniques: Keep all software and applications updated with the latest security patches.
Use threat intelligence services to identify and mitigate emerging vulnerabilities.
Implement network segmentation to contain potential attacks.

cyber_attacks.name: Insider Threat
cyber_attacks.description: A security risk originating from within the organization, often by employees or contractors.
mitigation_techniques: Conduct regular background checks and monitoring of employees.
Implement role-based access controls to limit data access.
Use security tools to monitor and detect unusual behavior or data exfiltration.

cyber_attacks.name: Credential Stuffing
cyber_attacks.description: An attack where stolen usernames and passwords are used to gain unauthorized access to accounts.
mitigation_techniques: Enforce multi-factor authentication on all accounts.
Encourage users to use unique passwords for each account.
Monitor and block suspicious login attempts using AI-driven tools.

cyber_attacks.name: Malware
cyber_attacks.description: Malicious software designed to harm or exploit any programmable device, network, or server.
mitigation_techniques: Install and update antivirus and anti-malware tools.
Avoid downloading files or software from untrusted sources.
Educate employees about identifying and avoiding malware attacks.
